summary: This UX/UI design provides a comprehensive blueprint for the '3T' Children's Tic Tac Toe app on React Native. The design focuses on creating a premium, engaging, and intuitive experience for young children, directly aligning with the BRD's objectives. We achieve this through a vibrant, friendly visual language, streamlined user flows, and delightful micro-interactions. The architecture is built on a scalable design system using React Native StyleSheet, ensuring consistency, maintainability, and a polished final product that fosters learning and fun.

screens.name: MainMenuScreen
screens.description: The entry point of the app, designed to be extremely simple and inviting for young children. It presents two clear, large, and visually distinct options to start a game, eliminating confusion and reducing cognitive load. The background is playful and static to keep the focus on the primary actions.
screens.wireframe:
<SafeAreaView style={styles.safeArea}>
  <View style={styles.container}>
    <Image source={{uri: 'logo_3t'}} style={styles.logo} accessibilityLabel="3T Game Logo" />
    <Text style={styles.tagline}>A Fun Game of Noughts & Crosses!</Text>
    <View style={styles.buttonContainer}>
      <PrimaryButton title="1 Player" icon="user" onPress={() => navigate('Game', { mode: 'single' })} />
      <PrimaryButton title="2 Players" icon="users" onPress={() => navigate('Game', { mode: 'multi' })} />
    </View>
  </View>
</SafeAreaView>

components.name: PrimaryButton
components.description: A large, touch-friendly button used for the main navigation choices. The design is soft, colorful, and includes a subtle shadow to make it feel tangible and press-able. An icon accompanies the text to aid comprehension for pre-readers.
components.notes: On press, the button should animate scaling down to 0.95 using `Animated.spring` for a bouncy, responsive feel. Use a `Pressable` component to manage this state. Accessibility label should combine icon and text, e.g., 'One player game'.

components.name: Logo
components.description: The application's primary logo. It should be friendly, colorful, and memorable, setting the tone for the entire app experience.
components.notes: The logo can have a subtle, slow-drifting animation using `Animated.loop` to add a touch of life to the main menu without being distracting.

screens.name: GameScreen
screens.description: The core gameplay screen. It features a large, clear 3x3 grid, a visual indicator for whose turn it is, and the friendly AI assistant. The design prioritizes focus on the game board, using a clean layout and minimal distractions.
screens.wireframe:
<SafeAreaView style={styles.safeArea}>
  <View style={styles.container}>
    <GameHeader turn="player1" />
    <GameBoard boardState={board} onCellPress={handlePress} />
    <AIAssistant message="Try the corner!" />
    <GameOverModal isVisible={isGameOver} result="win" />
  </View>
</SafeAreaView>

components.name: GameBoardCell
components.description: An individual, pressable cell within the 3x3 game grid. It has a clean, contained design and provides clear visual feedback when pressed. When a player makes a move, the 'X' or 'O' appears with a satisfying pop-in animation.
components.notes: Use `LayoutAnimation.spring()` when the 'X' or 'O' symbol appears to create a natural, bouncy entrance. The cell should be a `Pressable` component. For accessibility, its state ('X', 'O', or 'empty') should be announced.

components.name: GameHeader
components.description: Displays whose turn it is, using both text and a visual marker (e.g., highlighting the 'X' or 'O' icon). This provides an immediate, intuitive status update for the player.
components.notes: Animate the transition between turns. For example, the turn indicator could slide or fade between the 'X' and 'O' player sides. This provides clear, non-verbal feedback on the state change.

components.name: AIAssistant
components.description: A small, friendly mascot character that provides encouraging tips. This component embodies the educational objective from the BRD, making the AI feel like a helpful friend rather than a cold opponent.
components.notes: The mascot should have idle animations (e.g., blinking) to feel alive. When a new tip appears, the speech bubble should pop in using an `Animated.spring` animation. Tips should be timed to appear when a user is idle for a few seconds.

components.name: GameOverModal
components.description: A modal overlay that appears at the end of a game. It clearly states the outcome (Win, Lose, Draw) with celebratory or encouraging visuals and provides simple options to play again or return to the menu.
components.notes: The modal should animate in, scaling up from the center of the screen. For a win, confetti particles could animate using `react-native-confetti-cannon`. For a draw or loss, the animations should be more gentle and encouraging. All text and actions must be accessible.
